alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Newton (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Jasper and southwestern Newton Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 545 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Roberts, or 9 miles southwest of Newton, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Roberts around 550 PM CDT. Lawrence around 605 PM CDT. Newton around 615 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
